intro: Gymnadenia longispica, commonly known as the long-spurred gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous grasslands and meadows, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers have long, slender spurs that are a distinctive feature, and it blooms from June to August. Gymnadenia longispica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
